ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, tà pi metsèm tsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ pazíʼi pʉ̀a mmó, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie, peg pie peg zíʼi pʉ̀a mmó, ntí gie mé ge láʼ lɔg ŋaga wég, e ge láʼ tʉ cʉa ye petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Not many should become teachers, my brothers,   because you know that we will receive a stricter judgment.  # 3:1 Mt 23:8; Rm 2:20–21; 1Tm 1:7

ngiemboon: Pege pǔ fʉate menò ntí ntí, pɔ́ te vʉʼʉ nyìŋ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à laa tóo ńgɔɔn nò é fʉa wɔ́, mbà aa nyìŋ té ncÿǒ, ńkuʼu légwoonte mbùm ye ntsèm.
en: For we all stumble in many ways.   If anyone does not stumble in what he says, he is mature, able also to control the whole body.  # 3:2 Mt 12:37; Jms 1:26; 1Pt 3:10

ngiemboon: Pi líe melÿóon tá ńgyá, pege néŋe kwáŋ ncwò pɔ́b lélɔg ńgÿo ngie pɔ́ júʼ ncwò wégè, pege lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa jʉʼ gie pege ne ńkwoŋo.
en: Now if we put bits into the mouths of horses so that they obey us,   we direct their whole bodies.

ngiemboon: Pi líe mbɔɔ melánzì tá ńgyá, é fáŋ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́, fèfà gẅie à tsó yé tʉ pɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mbà setímà gie nyìŋ gẅie à ne shwoŋo lɔgɔ shwoŋo, ńnáa na jʉʼ gie à ne ńkwoŋo gwɔ̌ pɔ́ múɔ métsẅilé.
en: And consider ships: Though very large and driven by fierce winds, they are guided by a very small rudder wherever the will of the pilot directs.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ lʉ́me nyìŋ, áa na mekèm mbùm mé, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ métsẅilé, tá ńgwɔ́ á ŋáʼte tɛʼ.
en: So too, though the tongue is a small part of the body, it boasts great things.   Consider how a small fire sets ablaze a large forest.

ngiemboon: Alʉ́m gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yé pɔ́ mmɔ̌g, ńgwɔ́ jʉʼ gie menò tepòŋ fó wó. Alʉ́m áa na mekèm mbùm nyìŋ, ńgwɔ́ kèm gie á néŋ ncÿǒ na mbùm nnɛ́ ntsèm. Á gʉa lepÿé mmɔ̌g, ḿbí mmɔ̌g, ńtó ńdɔg ńtuɔ lenéŋè we nyìŋ pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: And the tongue is a fire. The tongue, a world of unrighteousness, is placed   among our members. It stains the whole body,  # 3:6 Ps 120:2–3; Pr 16:27; Mt 15:11,18 sets the course of life on fire, and is itself set on fire by hell.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ kuʼu lékúe menɔ̀ɔn tsẅɛ mentí mentí, ńkuʼu lékúe meshʉ̌ŋ, ńkuʼu lékúe menɔ̀ɔn pie é shwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b ssé, mbɔɔ lékúe messó.
en: Every kind of animal, bird, reptile, and fish is tamed and has been tamed by humankind,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na lʉ́m, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ te kuʼu lékúe wɔ́. Á tág jʉʼ té zẅɛte. Á gẅiin sìsìŋ gie á kúu na nyìŋ ńzẅé yé zẅé.
en: but no one can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔg pɔ́ lʉ́m, ńdɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Tá wege, ńgíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ yɛ̌, ńnéŋ ndòon twó pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie Ssé la pwóon, ńgÿo pɔ́ sẅé yé.
en: With the tongue we bless our Lord and Father, and with it we curse people who are made in God’s likeness.

ngiemboon: Mbʉ́lè mbɔɔ ndòon pú ńkẅɛɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tàʼ ncwò wémɔʼɔ́. Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, á kɔʼɔ́ te poŋ ngie à gwɔ́ púʼu wɔ́.
en: Blessing and cursing come out of the same mouth. My brothers and sisters, these things should not be this way.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lesaʼá ntse le ne fóo na jʉʼ, ńnáa ntse nǔ, ńgíŋe fó pɔ́ jʉʼó, ńnáa ntse gẅie é ne ńdẅe wɔ́.
en: Does a spring pour out sweet and bitter water from the same opening?

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé kába zoon na tÿǒ pÿɛ̀? Ńké ńkáb lepfo na tÿǒ zoon? Áa ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ lesaʼá ntse sie é ne ńnáa ntse gẅie é gẅiin ngwáŋ, ngwɔ́ é le ná ntse nǔ wɔ́.
en: Can a fig tree produce olives, my brothers and sisters, or a grapevine produce figs? Neither can a saltwater spring yield fresh water.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie à gẅiin zsénò, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin legye, á lɔgɔ tsẅé mbòŋo yé ńnyɛ, ńgíŋe ńdɔg mefàʼ mie é nyɛɛ ngie aa nyìŋ mbʉ́lè pʉlé ńgwɔ́ nzsènò, ńnyɛ.
en: Who among you is wise and understanding? By his good conduct he should show that his works are done in the gentleness that comes from wisdom.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńgẅiin kegɔ̀ʼ gẅie à léen ńgáʼ, mbɔɔ lʉŋte nnɛ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi, tà pi gíŋe ńŋáʼte ngie pi ee pazsénò, tà pi lɔg cÿɔ̌nò, ḿbyága nò nénʉ́.
en: But if you have bitter envy and selfish ambition in your heart, don’t boast and deny the truth.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí zsénò těen fóo tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ yɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ, éfóo mbwó messé tepòŋ.
en: Such wisdom does not come down from above but is earthly, unspiritual, demonic.

ngiemboon: Alʉŋte nnɛ́ mbɔɔ kegɔ̀ʼ vɔg tà ńgwɔ́ jʉʼ, atág mbɔɔ mefàʼ tepòŋ mentí mentí gwɔ́ wó.
en: For where there is envy and selfish ambition, there is disorder and every evil practice.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin zsénò gie á fóo tÿǒ lepwó, à zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie tsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ té na ngÿǒ menò mé wɔ́, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgiŋe pɔ́ lé mbʉ́lè, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mbʉ́lè pʉlé, ńgÿo nò á kuʼ kuʼ, ńzsé létsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe tɛʼ, éfaʼ mefàʼ mbòŋo pɔ́ púʼu. À te tyɛ̀ʼte gÿo, ńké te nkwòŋmenÿɔ́g wɔ́.
en: But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peace-loving, gentle, compliant, full of mercy and good fruits, unwavering, without pretense.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é lɔgɔ pɔ́ mbʉ́lè, ńnéŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, é ne ḿbye mmó lé mbʉ́lè. Mentɔ̌ɔn mie pɔ́ káb á gwɔ́ lenéŋè páʼ Ssé ne ńkwoŋo.
en: And the fruit of righteousness   is sown in peace by those who cultivate peace.
